channel.title: My PSP
channel.description: i got a new psp for my birthday on march 3rd... i have the wireless internet hooked up, some pics of my buddies, some of my rammstein songs, great! the manual says i can use KeepV to download youtube videos and google videos, but when i put in the URL to download the video, it downloads as a program file instead of a media player. i click it, all it does is bring up a list of programs i can open the file with, obviously bitmap wont work, i cant use the internet... what do i do?[br][size=1]Posted on: March 05, 2007, 11:47:57 AM[/size][hr]the manual says i can only play MPEG-4 (AAC).... and H.264/MPEG-4 AVC and baseline :mad:

The Custom Firmwares can play almost all kind of movies…

item.title: My PSP
item.dc:creator: @usernamelol .Fusion
item.description:
@usernamelol wrote:

Use the FireFox extension to download youtube videos, then use a converter to convert the media to psp format and add to the PSP.

item.title: My PSP
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

I know. Sony’s a bitch. Sony have told me that my PSP had ‘endless capabilities’. I can use the PSP as a PS3 controller, so what?

Pretty much, Sony makes the PSP sound absolutely great, but, it has its limits.

Overall, the PSP is a great toy. Nay, console. I wouldn’t leave mine, but there are some disappointments with it.

Read full topic

item.title: My PSP
item.dc:creator: @JaKobKain JaKobKain
item.description:

i got a new psp for my birthday on march 3rd… i have the wireless internet hooked up, some pics of my buddies, some of my rammstein songs, great! the manual says i can use KeepV to download youtube videos and google videos, but when i put in the URL to download the video, it downloads as a program file instead of a media player. i click it, all it does is bring up a list of programs i can open the file with, obviously bitmap wont work, i cant use the internet… what do i do?[br][size=1]Posted on: March 05, 2007, 11:47:57 AM[/size][hr]the manual says i can only play MPEG-4 (AAC)… and H.264/MPEG-4 AVC and baseline :mad:
